timeline.message: Do not limit batch size for scan case
Ensure TransformBatchP emits all the items
Fix race when applying the projector
Implement test for JoinByPrimitiveKeyProcessor using TestSupport
Fix outer non-key equi-join with additional join conditions

timeline.bodyText:
This query can be transformed to
SELECT 1 FROM b AS b1 JOIN b AS b2 ON 1=1
or to:
SELECT 1 FROM b AS b1, b AS b2
I'm surprised that cross join isn't handled by Calcite before we observe it...
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.message: Add join tests with type conversion
Add join method to the vertex name

timeline.bodyText:
Don't we need to do type conversion here? Imagine two maps:
m1: IMap<Integer, Integer>
m2: IMap<Integer, Long>
SELECT *
FROM m1
JOIN m2 USING(this)
the predicate will compare Integer to Long, which is always false.
Maybe calcite generates Project nodes to do the casting or maybe HZ Predicates handle it, i don't know. But I didn't see a test for that
timeline.author: viliam-durina

replies.bodyText: If types don't match then a CAST is inserted by Calcite and it's not an equi-join.
replies.author: gierlachg

timeline.bodyText: We should somehow use a distributed-partitioned edge in this case. The map.get call can then be local.
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText:
We should use this way every time we have an equi-join for right.__key, e.g.:
SELECT * 
FROM a JOIN b ON a.field=b.__key and b.field=10
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText:
We should:

cache the result entrySet for some time (like 10 seconds). We should cache it projected.
share it among local processors: maybe have a volatile field in the PSupplier and have 0th local processor update it for everyone.
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.message: Use key lookup whenever key equi-join condition is present
Turn on right side project pull up for outer joins
Use fanout() for non primitive key inner joins
Config option to disable the IMDG version check (#2610)

Add SQL CLI as jet sql command (#2654)

* Use JLine to read sql lines

* Add basic multiline support

* Add a way to cancel a streaming query

* Add SQL CLI documentation

* Workaround the jline race in signal handlers

See https://github.com/jline/jline3/pull/629

* Allow special commands to run without semicolon

Co-authored-by: Ufuk <ufuk.yilmaz@hazelcast.com>
Co-authored-by: Viliam Durina <viliam-durina@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Marko Topolnik <marko@hazelcast.com>
Use fanout() edge for joining using entrySet()
Add comments to various join variants
Improve error msg when joining a subquery or VALUES

Replace `boolean inner` with `RelJoinType`

We implied that `!inner == LEFT`, but that's not true in SQL, it was perplexing.
Unify JoinByPredicate inner and outer variants

timeline.bodyText: Why do we limit the batch size? We do entrySet repeatedly but only in order to have fresh data. But I think the batch can be unlimited here (and it's practically limited already, the inbox has limited size). It might even be better to scan for updated data once per second.
timeline.author: viliam-durina

replies.bodyText: Removed the limit. I would not cache IMap data as that would change the semantics - i.e. one could not update IMap then produce Kafka record and join it while currently this is the case for all the strategies we use internally.
replies.author: gierlachg
